sents.display: Presence of <mark data-entity="condition">conditions</mark><mark data-entity="negation_cue">other than</mark><mark data-entity="condition">Low Back Pain</mark>( LBP ) that could make it hard to assess or self-evaluate <mark data-entity="condition">pain</mark>
sents.text: Presence of conditions other than Low Back Pain ( LBP ) that could make it hard to assess or self-evaluate pain

sents.display: <mark data-entity="procedure">Surgery</mark>in low back area <mark data-entity="temporal">within 3 months</mark>of screening or <mark data-entity="procedure">expected surgery</mark>in the low back area during the study
sents.text: Surgery in low back area within 3 months of screening or expected surgery in the low back area during the study

sents.display: Any <mark data-entity="procedure">scheduled surgery</mark>or painful <mark data-entity="procedure">procedure</mark>during the study , or any <mark data-entity="qualifier">clinically</mark><mark data-entity="condition">significant disease</mark>that , in the opinion of the investigator , may affect efficacy or safety assessments
sents.text: Any scheduled surgery or painful procedure during the study , or any clinically significant disease that , in the opinion of the investigator , may affect efficacy or safety assessments

sents.display: History of <mark data-entity="condition">malignancy</mark><mark data-entity="temporal">within the past 2 years</mark>, with the <mark data-entity="negation_cue">exception</mark>of <mark data-entity="condition">basal cell carcinoma</mark>that has been treated and is no longer present
sents.text: History of malignancy within the past 2 years , with the exception of basal cell carcinoma that has been treated and is no longer present
Women who are pregnant or breast-feeding

sents.display: Moderately or <mark data-entity="condition">severely impaired liver function</mark>
sents.text: Moderately or severely impaired liver function

sents.display: History of <mark data-entity="condition">chronic hepatitis</mark>B or C , or <mark data-entity="condition">HIV</mark>, or presence of <mark data-entity="condition">active hepatitis</mark>B or C <mark data-entity="temporal">in past 3 months</mark>
sents.text: History of chronic hepatitis B or C , or HIV , or presence of active hepatitis B or C in past 3 months

sents.display: Clinically relevant history of <mark data-entity="condition">hypersensitivity</mark>, <mark data-entity="condition">allergy</mark>, or <mark data-entity="condition">contraindications</mark>to <mark data-entity="drug">acetaminophen</mark>or <mark data-entity="drug">opioid analgesics</mark>( or <mark data-entity="drug">ingredients</mark>)
sents.text: Clinically relevant history of hypersensitivity , allergy , or contraindications to acetaminophen or opioid analgesics ( or ingredients )

sents.display: Diagnosis of <mark data-entity="condition">Low Back Pain</mark>( LBP ) of <mark data-entity="condition">non-malignant origin</mark>present for <mark data-entity="temporal">at least 3 months</mark>immediately before study entry
sents.text: Diagnosis of Low Back Pain ( LBP ) of non-malignant origin present for at least 3 months immediately before study entry

sents.display: Taking <mark data-entity="drug">drug treatment</mark>for <mark data-entity="condition">pain</mark>for <mark data-entity="temporal">at least 3 months</mark>before screening and who are dissatisfied with <mark data-entity="temporal">current</mark><mark data-entity="drug">therapy</mark>
sents.text: Taking drug treatment for pain for at least 3 months before screening and who are dissatisfied with current therapy

sents.display: Subjects receiving <mark data-entity="drug">opioid treatment</mark>must have a total <mark data-entity="value">daily opioid dose < = 160 mg/day of oral morphine equivalent</mark>

terms.text: daily opioid dose < = 160 mg/day of oral morphine equivalent

sents.text: Subjects receiving opioid treatment must have a total daily opioid dose < = 160 mg/day of oral morphine equivalent

sents.display: For entry into open label period patients must have a <mark data-entity="measurement">baseline score</mark><mark data-entity="value">> = 5</mark>on an <mark data-entity="measurement">11-point NRS</mark>, calculated as the average <mark data-entity="condition">pain</mark>intensity during the last 3 days of the washout period
sents.text: For entry into open label period patients must have a baseline score > = 5 on an 11-point NRS , calculated as the average pain intensity during the last 3 days of the washout period

sents.display: For entry into the double-blind period subjects must have remained on the same optimal stable dose and frequency of tapentadol ( CG5503 ) IR administration <mark data-entity="temporal">during the last 3 days</mark>of the open-label <mark data-entity="procedure">treatment</mark>period
sents.text: For entry into the double-blind period subjects must have remained on the same optimal stable dose and frequency of tapentadol ( CG5503 ) IR administration during the last 3 days of the open-label treatment period
